channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Perl Advent Calendars, 2011 edition.
item.description: Andrew Grangaard (low level manager) collected links to a number of Perl related Advent calendars. His blog can be a good starting point to explore Dancer, Catalyst, Perl 6 or a number of other topics in English. For the more adventures, and for the natives of the respective countries, there is a long list of Japanese and even a Korean Advent calendar.

item.title: Augmenting the Perl debugger for fun and profit
item.description: Mithaldu, who is also known as as Christian Walde, explains why it is good to let your debugger skip on internal calls and how to do that using his brand new DB::Skip.

item.title: Goodbye // I'll miss you
item.description: John McNamara, the author and maintainer of various Excel related modules explains why did he revert his decision, and started to support perl 5.8.2 as well. I think all the corporate users owe him big thanks. Me included.

item.title: Google Code-in - Fit the Second
item.description: Mark Keating (MDK) reports on the progress of TPF in the Google Code-in after two weeks of work. In a nutshell: things are looking good but more students, mentors and tasks are needed.

item.title: How to Parse HTML
item.description: I am very impressed by the persistence of Jeffrey Kegler in explaining what is Marpa and showing how it can be used. This time he picks up a piece of real world HTML code and shows how to parse it and how to deal with missing tags.

item.title: Visualization of the Mojo class tree
item.description: A nice picture by Marcus Ramberg showing the class hierarchy of Mojo and Mojolicious.

item.title: How do I get a unique Perl Interpreter ID?
item.description: Sebastian Willing pointed me to this discussion on Perl Monks

item.title: Controlling Test Parallelism with prove
item.description: If you like taking a nap while your tests are running don't read this! chromatic shows two very interesting features of the prove command that might allow you to save as much as 80% of the time spend running tests.

item.title: Temporary Directory Handling in Tests
item.description: For parallel testing, you need to make sure two tests won't try to access the same part of the file system. File::Tempdir is a good solution but chromatic needed some more features.

item.title: Test::NoWarnings 1.04 - Immediate warnings with :early pragma
item.description: Adam Kennedy, who is now maintaining Test::NoWarnings, allows us to see the warnings as they happen, instead of at the end of the test script. This can be an improvement for debugging.

item.title: exec's portability
item.description: A very interesting question by Shlomi Fish regarding the different behavior of exec and command line parameters on Windows and Linux, and a very nice explanation by Aristotle Pagaltzis.

item.title: New 1.33 release of Perl DBD::ODBC
item.description: Martin Evans details what's new in DBD::ODBC.

item.title: DBD::SQLite 1.35 released
item.description: Adam Kennedy details the content of this new release.

item.title: DC Perl Monks Podcast
item.description: Zachary Zebrowski (japharl) writes that the DC Perl Mongers have started to publish a podcast of their monthly meetings. An idea some other PM groups might want to follow. Maybe even making videos? Am I now greedy?

item.title: Perl 6 Advent Calendar
item.description: Instead of linking to the individual posts, let me point you directly to the top of the Perl 6 Advent calendar.

item.title: Memcached statistics (stats command)
item.description: Sebastian Willing collected some information on how to get statistics from memcached using Cache::Memcached.

item.title: London Perl Workshop
item.description: Unfortunately O'Reilly's Josette Garcia couldn't be at the London Perl Workshop so Dave Cross posted his report on her blog.

item.title: Saint Perl 2011 Conference
item.description: December 18, 2011, Saint-Petersburg, Russia

item.title: The Perl Oasis
item.description: January 13-15, 2012, Orlando, Florida, USA

item.title: Perl Workshop in Israel
item.description: February 28, 2012, Ramat Gan, Israel

item.title: German Perl workshop
item.description: March 5-7, 2012, Erlangen, Germany
